ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Does man reckon he will be left to go on unchecked?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Does man think that he will be left alone to himself, free?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Does man think that he will be left alone, unquestioned?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: For you, the human being of such behavior, will certainly deserve it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Does man assume that he will be let loose?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Does man think that he will be left neglected
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Does man think that he is to be left to wander without an aim?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What, does man reckon he shall be left to roam at will?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Thinketh man that he is to be left aimless?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Does man, then, think that he is to be left to himself, to go about at will?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Deemest man that he is to be left uncontrolled?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Does man suppose that he has been abandoned to futility?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Does man think that he will be left uncontrolled, (without purpose)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Does man think that he will be left Suda [neglected without being punished or rewarded for the obligatory duties enjoined by his Lord (Allah) on him]?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Does the human think he will be left to roam at will?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Does man think that he will be left without purpose?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Does man think that he will be left neglected?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:36] Does man suppose that he is to be left aimless?, left to his own devices without being obligated to the [prescribed] laws: let him not suppose that!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: The Qur'an also said: (Thinks man) the disbelieving man, i.e. Abu Jahl (that he is to be left aimless) neglected, without any commands, prohibitions or admonition?
